edu.rit.image

Class GrayImageQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.image.ImageQueue
      • edu.rit.image.GrayImageQueue

  • public class GrayImageQueue
extends ImageQueue
    Class GrayImageQueue provides a queue of pixel rows for an image, with the pixel data stored using class GrayArray. A gray image queue is constructed by the getImageQueue() method of class GrayPngWriter.

    The methods of class GrayImageQueue are multiple thread safe.

    See Also:
    ImageQueue, GrayPngWriter

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void put(int row, GrayArray data)
      Put the given pixel data into the given row of this image queue.
      GrayArray remove(int row)
      Remove the pixel data from the given row of this image queue.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(int row,
       GrayArray data)
         throws InterruptedException
        Put the given pixel data into the given row of this image queue. If this row already contains pixel data, the put() method blocks until this row's pixel data has been removed.

        Note: A copy of the data array is stored in this image queue, so the data array can be reused for another row.

        Parameters:
        row - Row index in the range 0 .. rows()−1.
        data - Array of pixel data; its length must be equal to cols().
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if row is out of bounds.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if data is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if data.length() ≠ cols().
        InterruptedException - Thrown if the calling thread is interrupted while blocked in this method.

      • remove

        public GrayArray remove(int row)
                 throws InterruptedException
        Remove the pixel data from the given row of this image queue. If this row does not contain pixel data, the remove() method blocks until pixel data has been put into this row.
        Parameters:
        row - Row index in the range 0 .. rows()−1.
        Returns:
        Array of pixel data.
        Throws:
        ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if row is out of bounds.
        InterruptedException - Thrown if the calling thread is interrupted while blocked in this method.
